page.title: 01THE TOWN OF CONGLETON
page.content: Congleton is a small town of around 25,000 INHABITANTS in South East Cheshire.Granted a charter in 1272 it is a market town with excellent amenities. Communications around the Congleton area are of a reasonable standard with both rail and road links to other parts of the country. Surrounding Congleton itself there are extensive areas of grazing landwith small villages scattered nearby.Some of this agricultural land has in recent years been built upon. The area has traditionally looked toward the textile INDUSTRY to be the major source of employment.Also the area has developed into a commuter belt for nearby Manchester. Housing is mixed,ranging from council estates to older type terraces.The area presents a varied and diverse landscape.
